page.title: 18O'Hara's Castle Portstewart
page.content: Now St.Mary's Dominican College,Rock Castle was originally built by Henry O'Hara in 1834. It was three storeys high and had a basement. There were 4 corner turrets two of which had circular staircases. When Henry O'Hara died in 1844,the castle was extended. The castle became the property of the Cromie family,who lived at Cromore House,before being bought from them by the Dominican Sisters in 1917. They extended the castle in 1929 and had a chapel added in 1935. From 1963 to 1965 further extensions were carried out to enlarge the Convent school which is now a college,catering for both boys and girls from the age of 11 years to 18 years. Rock Castle is a prominent feature of the Portstewart coastline.
